sad: Write a short gratitude note to yourself.
Listen to soft, calming instrumental music.
Take a 10-minute walk in fresh air.
Talk to a trusted friend or sibling.
Write your feelings in a journal for 5 minutes.
Drink a glass of water and take 3 deep breaths.
stressed: Break tasks into micro-steps and complete one small thing.
Stretch your neck and shoulders for 2 minutes.
Do 5 slow belly-breaths with eyes closed.
Take a 5-minute nature break (look outside or walk slowly).
anxious: Slowly sip warm water or tea.
Write down your top 3 worries and label them 'Not urgent'.
Relax your shoulders consciously and lift your chin slightly.
Repeat: 'I am safe. I am in control. This will pass.'
angry: Pause and breathe: inhale 6 seconds, exhale 6 seconds.
Splash cool water on your face.
Leave the room for 2 minutes to reset.
Write what made you angry, then tear the paper.
Squeeze a stress ball or pillow firmly for 10 seconds.
Listen to calming rain or nature sounds.
happy: Write a quick gratitude list of 3 good things.
Take 2 minutes to breathe deeply and enjoy the moment.
Capture the moment in a journal or note.
Do one small act of kindness today.
neutral: Stretch your arms and back slowly.
Drink water and rest your eyes for 20 seconds.
Check in with your body posture.
Take a short walk or move around.
Try noticing 3 things around you without judging them.
